ArticleTitle.sentence: The regulation of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha promoter region in macrophage, T cell, and B cell lines.

event.clue: The regulation of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha promoter region in macrophage, T cell, and B cell lines.
The regulation of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha promoter region in macrophage, T cell, and B cell lines.
The regulation of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha promoter region in macrophage, T cell, and B cell lines.

AbstractText.sentence: The 1311-base pair human tumor necrosis factor (TNF) alpha promoter region was fused to the luciferase (Luc) reporter gene and studied in a transient transfection system in three TNF producing cell lines, the U937 macrophage cell line, the MLA 144 T cell line, and the 729-6 B cell line.

event.clue: The 1311-base pair human tumor necrosis factor (TNF) alpha promoter region was fused to the luciferase (Luc) reporter gene and studied in a transient transfection system in three TNF producing cell lines, the U937 macrophage cell line, the MLA 144 T cell line, and the 729-6 B cell line.

The 1311-base pair human tumor necrosis factor (TNF) alpha promoter region was fused to the luciferase (Luc) reporter gene and studied in a transient transfection system in three TNF producing cell lines, the U937 macrophage cell line, the MLA 144 T cell line, and the 729-6 B cell line.

The 1311-base pair human tumor necrosis factor (TNF) alpha promoter region was fused to the luciferase (Luc) reporter gene and studied in a transient transfection system in three TNF producing cell lines, the U937 macrophage cell line, the MLA 144 T cell line, and the 729-6 B cell line.

AbstractText.sentence: This full length promoter construct can be induced by phorbol 13-myristate acetate (PMA) in each of these cell types.

event.clue: This full length promoter construct can be induced by phorbol 13-myristate acetate (PMA) in each of these cell types.

AbstractText.sentence: Analysis of a series of 5'-truncations showed several peaks of basal and PMA induced activity suggesting the presence of several positive and negative regulatory elements.

event.clue: Analysis of a series of 5'-truncations showed several peaks of basal and PMA induced activity suggesting the presence of several positive and negative regulatory elements.

AbstractText.sentence: A PMA responsive element was localized to a region between -95 and -36 bp relative to the transcription start site.
Within this region, single AP-2- and AP-1- like consensus sequences were noted.
These AP-2 and AP-1 sites were each modified with a double point mutation.

event.clue: These AP-2 and AP-1 sites were each modified with a double point mutation.
These AP-2 and AP-1 sites were each modified with a double point mutation.

AbstractText.sentence: A modest (20-50%) reduction in TNF promoter activity was observed with the AP-2 site mutation.

event.clue: A modest (20-50%) reduction in TNF promoter activity was observed with the AP-2 site mutation.
A modest (20-50%) reduction in TNF promoter activity was observed with the AP-2 site mutation.

AbstractText.sentence: However, mutation of the AP-1 site markedly diminished both the basal and PMA-activated promoter activity.

event.clue: However, mutation of the AP-1 site markedly diminished both the basal and PMA-activated promoter activity.
However, mutation of the AP-1 site markedly diminished both the basal and PMA-activated promoter activity.
However, mutation of the AP-1 site markedly diminished both the basal and PMA-activated promoter activity.
However, mutation of the AP-1 site markedly diminished both the basal and PMA-activated promoter activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Also co-transfections of the wild-type promoter construct with an AP-1/c-jun expression vector resulted in augmented basal and PMA-induced promoter activity.

event.clue: Also co-transfections of the wild-type promoter construct with an AP-1/c-jun expression vector resulted in augmented basal and PMA-induced promoter activity.
Also co-transfections of the wild-type promoter construct with an AP-1/c-jun expression vector resulted in augmented basal and PMA-induced promoter activity.
